name: Penguin News Art Print Unframed
description:
-
LIMITED EDITION: 
Signed, dated and numbered: Limited Edition applies to the following art-print sizes: 50x70cm, 70x100cm & 100x142cm. 25 units per size.

OPEN EDITION: 
Signed and dated: Open Edition applies to the following art-print size:30x40cm. No number limit on art-print production

This is a signed fine art print.

It was lovingly created from an original cut paper collage created by Nicholas Girling, coloured digitally and printed onto Canson gallery grade paper of 310gsm soft white uncoated art paper (LIMITED EDITION) or 176gsm Superfine fine art-paper (OPEN EDITION). The papers are acid and chlorine free and meet International Archival Standards.

Please note: The colour of prints is represented as close to real life as possible. As computer monitors can show things a little differently with colour please allow slight variations from monitor to my art print.

DELIVERY
This unique art will be shipped in a heavy duty postal tube or solid mailer to protect it via Air Mail. Australia, New Zealand: 7-10 working days. USA, Europe & Asia: approx 21 working days. Delivery price will be automatically calculated during checkout based on delivery address.

Pickup can also be organised and we will refund the shipping charge should you choose to pick up from the Melbourne Richmond Australia studio. 

PRICES
Prices are in Australian dollars. Shipping is calculated based on delivery address during checkout. Australian customers: Payment can be made either via Credit Card, Paypal account, or via direct deposit via email.

QUESTION
hello@nicholasgirling.com or don't hesitate to call 0418 505 241. You are also welcome to come into my studio by appointment to see many of the art prints up close. Studio hours are Mon to Fri 9 - 6pm.

All rights reserved. © Nicholas Girling 2012

name: The Hunt - Art Print Unframed
description:
--
The Hunt: Features the greek deity Artemis of the wildland, Mistress of Animals. She was the Hellenic goddess of the hunt, wild animals, wilderness, childbirth, bringing and relieving disease in women.

--
Limited Edition applies to the following art-print sizes: 
50x70cm, 70x100cm & 100x142cm. 
Limited to 25 units per size.

A Larger size is available only upon request. 
(133 x 173cm) Limited to 5 units per size.

OPEN EDITION: 
Signed and dated: Open Edition applies to the following art-print size:30x40cm. No number limit on art-print production

This is a signed fine art print.

A combination of hand drawn and digitally created artwork created by Nicholas Girling, coloured digitally and printed onto Canson gallery grade paper of 310gsm soft white uncoated art paper (LIMITED EDITION) or 176gsm Superfine fine art-paper (OPEN EDITION) and for the largest  (LIMITED EDITION) size, UV laminated stock. The papers are acid and chlorine free and meet International Archival Standards.

Please note: The colour of prints is represented as close to real life as possible. As computer monitors can show things a little differently with colour please allow slight variations from monitor to my art print.

DELIVERY
This unique art will be shipped in a heavy duty postal tube or solid mailer to protect it via Air Mail. Australia, New Zealand: 7-10 working days. USA, Europe & Asia: approx 21 working days. Delivery price will be automatically calculated during checkout based on delivery address.

Pickup can also be organised and we will refund the shipping charge should you choose to pick up from the Melbourne Richmond Australia studio.

name: Delicious Chicken - Art Print Unframed
description:
--
Art Print - based on 
Greek Chicken With Olives
1 chicken, cut up 
3 tbsp. olive oil 
5 cloves chopped garlic 
3 yellow onions, peeled and chopped 
3 cups ripe fresh tomatoes, coarsely chopped 
1 6-oz jar green olives with pimientos 
freshly ground pepper 
1 tbsp. oregano 
1 cup dry red wine 
salt to taste 

This art print is not food but delicious none the less.
-
Limited Edition applies to the following art-print sizes: 
50x70cm, 70x100cm & 100x142cm. 
Limited to 25 units per size.

A Larger size is available only upon request. 
(133 x 173cm) Limited to 5 units per size.

OPEN EDITION: 
Signed and dated: Open Edition applies to the following art-print size:30x40cm. No number limit on art-print production

This is a signed fine art print.

A combination of hand drawn and digitally created artwork created by Nicholas Girling, coloured digitally and printed onto Canson gallery grade paper of 310gsm soft white uncoated art paper (LIMITED EDITION) or 176gsm Superfine fine art-paper (OPEN EDITION) and for the largest  (LIMITED EDITION) size, UV laminated stock. The papers are acid and chlorine free and meet International Archival Standards.

Please note: The colour of prints is represented as close to real life as possible. As computer monitors can show things a little differently with colour please allow slight variations from monitor to my art print.

DELIVERY
This unique art will be shipped in a heavy duty postal tube or solid mailer to protect it via Air Mail. Australia, New Zealand: 7-10 working days. USA, Europe & Asia: approx 21 working days. Delivery price will be automatically calculated during checkout based on delivery address.

Pickup can also be organised and we will refund the shipping charge should you choose to pick up from the Melbourne Richmond Australia studio. 

PRICES
Prices are in Australian dollars. Shipping is calculated based on delivery address during checkout. Australian customers: Payment can be made either via Credit Card, Paypal account, or via direct deposit via email.

QUESTION
hello@nicholasgirling.com or don't hesitate to call 0418 505 241. You are also welcome to come into my studio by appointment to see many of the art prints up close. Studio hours are Mon to Fri 9 - 6pm. Weekend appointments are upon availability.

All rights reserved. © Nicholas Girling 2012

name: HELIOS Art print Unframed
description:
--
HELIOS, also known as the Greek sun god, is said to have had seven herds of oxen and seven flocks of sheep, each numbering fifty head. Here we have the artists interpretation of HELIOS as represented by the sun. The cow is a link to a modern day cattle. Simple and iconic.

-
